Summary

Biography

2003: Again proved to be a vital part of the receiving corps...grabbed his first reception against UCF, a five-yard score...second catch of the season was also a score, a 14-yard connection with quarterback Danny Embick against Siena...had two more receptions in 2004, including his season long of 16 against in-state rival FIU.

2002: Reported to camp fighting for a spot on the travel roster, by season’s end he was a week-to-week starter…had his second collegiate reception in the season opener, a game played against Division I A USF…the two-yard reception resulted in a FAU TD…the TD was his first collegiate score…he had five multiple receptions games, the best outing was four receptions for 24 yards and his season long reception was a 22-yard grab against FIU, a game which he had a total of 31 yards.

2001: Played in eight games...longest reception was a 14 yard grab against St. Mary=s.

2000: Scrappiness was his edge in both fall and spring workouts.

High School: Played for Bill MaGee at Vineland High School...participated in the Fame Bowl of South Jersey...served as team captain as a senior...member of the honor roll and earned the Cum Laude Award...two-sport athlete (football and baseball).

Personal: Sociology major...son of Benjamin Coker, Jr. and Sharon Gray...born October 18, 1981 in Vineland, NJ.

No stats available for the current season.
